marketNews.title: MSCI Indices Evaluation August 2025
marketNews.content: MSCI announced the evaluation of the Global Standard, Small Cap, and Micro Cap stock indices, effective August 27, 2025. Here are the details: MSCI Indonesia Global Standard Inclusion: DSSA, CUAN Exclusion: ADRO MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Inclusion: AADI, ADRO, KPIG, PTRO, RATU, TAPG Exclusion: MBMA, PNLF MSCI Indonesia Micro Cap Inclusion: - Exclusion: - The next evaluation will be announced on November 5, 2025, with an effective date of November 25, 2025. Key Takeaway: Issuers entering the above indices will receive inflow, potentially serving as a positive catalyst for their stock price movements. Following this news, the majority of stocks included in the MSCI indices closed higher today, Friday (8/8), with DSSA (+20%), CUAN (+7.2%), AADI (+2.8%), PTRO (+9%), RATU (+5.4%), and TAPG (+2.4%) closing up, while KPIG weakened (-1.9%). On the other hand, stocks that were downgraded and/or excluded from the MSCI indices experienced price weakening today, such as ADRO (-4.3%), MBMA (-7.3%), and PNLF (-1.6%).

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Noted July 2025 Car Wholesales Sales Were Only 60,552 Units
marketNews.content: Gaikindo noted that car wholesales sales in July 2025 only reached 60,552 units (-18% YoY, +5% MoM). This realization brings the wholesales for 7M25 to 435,293 units (-10% YoY), equivalent to only 48-58% of Gaikindo's 2025 target in the range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 7M24: 56% realization in 2024).

marketNews.title: Indonesian Motorcycle Sales Reached ~3.7 Million Units in 7M25
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales in July 2025 reached 587,048 units (-2% YoY, +15.3% MoM). This result brought domestic motorcycle sales during 7M25 to approximately 3.7 million units (-2.1% YoY), equivalent to 55-58% of AISI's 2025 target in the range of 6.4-6.7 million units (vs. 7M24: 60% realization in 2024).

marketNews.title: Shopee is the Most Accessed E-commerce Platform in Indonesia in 2025
marketNews.content: A survey from the Indonesian Internet Service Providers Association showed that Shopee became the most frequently accessed e-commerce platform by Indonesian internet users in 2025 with an access share of 53.22%, up from the previous year's level of 41.65%. Meanwhile, Tiktok Shop recorded an access share of 27.37% (vs. 2024: 12.2%), and Tokopedia stood at 9.57% (vs. 2024: 9.4%). Lazada's access share dropped to 9.09% in 2025 (vs. 2024: 17.54%), followed by Blibli (BELI) which fell to 0.29% (vs. 2024: 0.36%).

marketNews.title: Indonesia's 10-Year Benchmark Yield Falls to Lowest Since September 2023
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the yield on the Indonesian government's 10-year bond fell -3 bps to the 6.42% level on Friday (8/8), marking the lowest point since September 2023. This decline occurred amidst rising expectations of a Fed rate cut at the September 2025 meeting following weaker-than-expected US employment data. Furthermore, soft US dollar movements and the expectation that Bank Indonesia will conduct further rate cuts also fueled the rally in Indonesian government bonds. Bloomberg noted that foreign investors have bought up Indonesian government bonds worth up to 3.5 billion US dollars since the beginning of 2025, already surpassing the inflow throughout 2024.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index Rose to 118.1 in July 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the Indonesian consumer confidence index increased to the level of 118.1 in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 117.8, July 2024: 123.4). This result was driven by increases in almost all sub-indices, except for the current income index which decreased by -2.4 points to 117.8 and the business activity expectation index which weakened by -1.8 points to 127.5.

marketNews.title: REI DKI Jakarta Pushes 50 Developers to Seek Capital Through IPOs to Support 3-Million-House Program
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the DKI Jakarta Regional Board of the Indonesian Real Estate Association (REI), Arvin F. Iskandar, stated on Thursday (7/8) that REI targets 50 developers who are REI members to conduct IPOs soon. This plan is intended to strengthen developers' capital positions to support housing supply and ensure the success of the government's 3 million house program. To succeed in this plan, REI DKI Jakarta will push for the establishment of the Jakarta Property Index as an indicator of regional property sector performance, which can be a reference for domestic and international investors. REI is also mentioned to facilitate around 10-20 developers per year to conduct IPOs or issue other property investment instruments. Arvin himself explained that currently only 1% of the total 500 DPP REI members are listed on the stock exchange.

tickerNews.title: Commissioner of GULA Buys 140 Million PPRI Shares from CEO for Retirement Preparation
tickerNews.content: Commissioner Utama of Aman Agrindo (GULA), Irsyad Hanif, bought 140 million shares of Paperocks Indonesia (PPRI) at an average price of 50 rupiah per share from the President Director of PPRI, Catur Jatiwaluyo, on August 7, 2025. After this transaction, Irsyad Hanif's ownership in PPRI increased from 2.6% to 15.6%, while Catur Jatiwaluyo's ownership decreased from 13% to none. In a separate transaction, the founder of Remala Abadi (DATA), Budi Aditya Erna Mulyanto, bought 97.2 million shares of PPRI at an average price of 159 rupiah per share on August 5, 2025. After this transaction, Budi Aditya Erna Mulyanto's ownership in PPRI increased from 4.65% to 13.69%. Irsyad and Budi explained that these transactions were intended for long-term investment. Meanwhile, the Corporate Secretary of PPRI, Dillon Sutandar, stated that Catur's divestment was intended for retirement preparation.

tickerNews.title: KIJA Marketing Sales Reach IDR 741 Billion in 2Q25, Driven by Kendal Industrial Estate Joint Venture
tickerNews.content: Kawasan Industri Jababeka (KIJA) recorded marketing sales of IDR 741 billion in 2Q25 (-31% YoY, -37% QoQ). This result brought marketing sales during 1H25 to IDR 1.9 trillion (+13% YoY), equivalent to approximately 55% of the 2025 target of IDR 3.5 trillion. The joint venture of KIJA in the Kendal Industrial Estate contributed 73% of the total marketing sales in 1H25.

tickerNews.title: Amman Mineral Internasional Director Sells ~28 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The Director of Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN), David Alexander Gibbs, sold approximately 28 million AMMN shares at an average price of 7,492 rupiah per share on August 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 209.7 billion. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of David Alexander Gibbs in AMMN decreased from 0.055% to 0.016%.

tickerNews.title: Steward of NICL Buys ~3 Million Shares, Increasing Direct Ownership
tickerNews.content: The Controller of PAM Mineral (NICL), Christopher Sumasto Tjia, bought approximately 3 million NICL shares at an average price of 1,035 rupiah per share on August 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 3.1 billion. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Christopher Sumasto Tjia in NICL increased from 0.454% to 0.482%.

tickerNews.title: MSIN Plans Private Placement Up to ~6.1 Billion New Shares, Dilution Up to 9.09%
tickerNews.content: MNC Digital Entertainment (MSIN) plans to hold a private placement of up to approximately 6.1 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.09%, where the acquired funds are intended to strengthen the company's capital structure. The execution price and prospective investors have not yet been announced. This plan will be discussed in the EGM (RUPSLB) on September 15, 2025.

tickerNews.content: A survey from the Indonesian Internet Service Providers Association showed that Shopee became the most frequently accessed e-commerce platform by Indonesian internet users in 2025 with an access share of 53.22%, up from the previous year's level of 41.65%. Meanwhile, Tiktok Shop recorded an access share of 27.37% (vs. 2024: 12.2%), and Tokopedia stood at 9.57% (vs. 2024: 9.4%). Lazada's access share dropped to 9.09% in 2025 (vs. 2024: 17.54%), followed by Blibli (BELI) which fell to 0.29% (vs. 2024: 0.36%).
